sense.name: government bigwig
sense.commentary: A person, usually in the government, in charge of a department.
sense.examples: Today the Secretary of Defense declared his intention to invade Switzerland. Tomorrow you're going to be elected Secretary-General of the United Nations. As of yesterday, the position of Secretary of Labor was still unoccupied.

sense.name: office assistant
sense.commentary: Someone who works in an office and typically handles correspondence and clerical work for a boss or an organization.
sense.examples: John got a low-paying job as Mary's secretary. I'll have my secretary set up a lunch meeting between us.

sense.name: secret-keeper
sense.commentary: A person to whom a secret is entrusted. This was the original meaning of "secretary", though it is rarely used today.
sense.examples: The Illuminati and the Freemasons are secretaries for the truth of the Roswell UFO landing.

sense.name: writing desk
sense.commentary: A desk used for writing, also called an escritoire and a secretaire.
sense.examples: John sat down at his secretary and composed a memo to the President.
